Caesar dressing, when served as part of a salad, appears as a **creamy, smooth, moderately thick sauce** that clings well to salad leaves rather than being runny or soupy. It is typically **off-white to light beige** in color, sometimes with small visible flecks from ingredients like garlic or capers (in vegan versions) or anchovies and Parmesan in traditional ones.
